sen.j: 三浦 桃寿丸（みうら とうじゅまる、生年不詳 - 天正12年（1584年））は、日本の戦国時代の武将。
sen.e: Tojumaru MIURA (year of birth unknown - 1584) was a Japanese military commander who lived during the Sengoku Period (Period of Warring States).
sen.cmt: 原文に「戦国時代（日本）」とありますがリンク先の用語と混ざっているようです。ウェブを確認し、「戦国時代」として訳出いたしました。
sen.e: Tojumaru MIURA (year of birth unknown - 1584) was a Japanese military commander who lived during the Sengoku Period (Period of Warring States).
Tojumaru MIURA (year of birth unknown - 1584) was a Japanese military commander who lived during the Sengoku Period (Period of Warring States).

sen.j: 父は美作国の国人領主・三浦貞勝、母は円融院。
sen.e: His father was Sadakatsu MIURA, who was a local lord of Mimasaka Province, and his mother was Enyuin.
His father was Sadakatsu MIURA, who was a local lord of Mimasaka Province, and his mother was Enyuin.
His father was Sadakatsu MIURA, who was a local lord of Mimasaka Province, and his mother was Enyuin.

sen.j: 異父弟に豊臣政権五大老になった宇喜多秀家がいる。
sen.e: Hideie UKITA, who later became one of the Gotairo (Council of Five Elders) of the Toyotomi government, was his younger maternal half-brother.
Hideie UKITA, who later became one of the Gotairos (Council of Five Elders) of the Toyotomi government, was his younger maternal half-brother.
Hideie UKITA, who later became one of the Gotairos (Council of Five Elders) of the Toyotomi government, was his younger maternal half-brother.

sen.j: 生年不明であるが、父・貞勝が死亡した永禄8年（1565年）以前と推定される。
sen.e: His birth year is unknown, but it is supposed that he was born before 1565, when his father Sadakatsu died.
His birth year is unknown, but it is assumed that he was born before 1565, when his father Sadakatsu died.
His birth year is unknown, but it is assumed that he was born before 1565, when his father Sadakatsu died.

sen.j: 備中国の国人領主三村家親により父・三浦貞勝が自害したため、母と共に備前国津高郡下土井村に逃れ、更に宇喜多直家の元に身を寄せた。
sen.e: As his father Sadakatsu committed suicide due to Iechika MIMURA, a local lord of Bicchu Province, he and his mother escaped to Shimodoi Village, Tsudaka County, Bizen Province, and then they went to Naoie UKITA and stayed at his place.

As his father Sadakatsu committed suicide due to Iechika MIMURA, a local lord of Bicchu Province, he and his mother escaped to Shimodoi Village, Tsudaka County, Bizen Province, and then they went to Naoie UKITA and stayed at his place.

As his father Sadakatsu committed suicide due to Iechika MIMURA, a local lord of Bicchu Province, he and his mother escaped to Shimodoi Village, Tsudaka County, Bizen Province, and then they went to Naoie UKITA and stayed at his place.

sen.j: その後異父弟の宇喜多秀家が産まれたが、義父の直家には実子の秀家と共に我が子同然に育てられた。
sen.e: Subsequently, Hideie UKITA, Tojumaru's younger maternal half-brother, was born, and Tojumaru's stepfather Naoie raised Tojumaru just like his biological son, together with his real biological son Hideie.
Later, Hideie UKITA, Tojumaru's younger maternal half-brother, was born, and Tojumaru's stepfather Naoie raised Tojumaru just like his biological son, together with his real biological son Hideie.
Later, Hideie UKITA, Tojumaru's younger maternal half-brother, was born, and Tojumaru's stepfather Naoie raised Tojumaru just like his biological son, together with his real biological son Hideie.

sen.j: 天正12年（1584年）、京都に上った時に地震に遭い圧死し、美作三浦氏は滅亡する。
sen.e: In 1584, Tojumaru was involved in an earthquake and crushed to death when he went up to Kyoto, and consequently, the Mimasaka Miura clan became extinct.
In 1584, Tojumaru was crushed to death in an earthquake when he went up to Kyoto, and consequently, the Mimasaka Miura clan became extinct.
sen.cmt: Re-wrote the first part of the sentence.
sen.e: In 1584, Tojumaru was crushed to death in an earthquake when he went up to Kyoto, and consequently, the Mimasaka Miura clan became extinct.

sen.j: なぜ京都に上ったのか、異父弟・秀家の名代で参上したものなのか、単なる単独行動なのか、理由は不明である。
sen.e: The purpose of his Kyoto visit remains a mystery, and it is also unknown whether he went up to Kyoto on behalf of his younger maternal half-brother Hideie, or he just visited Kyoto by himself.
The purpose of his Kyoto visit remains a mystery, and it is also unknown whether he went up to Kyoto on behalf of his younger maternal half-brother Hideie, or he just visited Kyoto by himself.
The purpose of his Kyoto visit remains a mystery, and it is also unknown whether he went up to Kyoto on behalf of his younger maternal half-brother Hideie, or he just visited Kyoto by himself.

sen.j: 当時の状況を考えるに、宇喜多氏と豊臣秀吉との関係で上洛していた可能性が高いと思われる。
sen.e: Considering circumstances of those days, it is highly likely that he went up to Kyoto because of a relationship between the Ukita clan and Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI.
Considering the circumstances of those days, it is highly likely that he went up to Kyoto because of a relationship between the Ukita clan and Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI.
Considering the circumstances of those days, it is highly likely that he went up to Kyoto because of a relationship between the Ukita clan and Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI.

sen.j: 年齢を考慮すると、20歳以上での死去が確定的であるが、なぜか元服の記録が残っておらず、その名前も判然としない。
sen.e: It is certain that he was 20 years old or over when he died considering his age, but a record of his coming-of-age ceremony is not left at all and his adult name is unknown.
sen.cmt: 原文に「年齢を考慮すると」とありますが、文脈から考えると「没年を考慮すると」の誤りでないかと思われます。ただしここでは原文通りに訳出いたしました。
sen.e: It is certain that he was 20 years old or more when he died considering his age, but a record of his coming-of-age ceremony is no where to be found and his adult name is unknown.
sen.cmt: over → more. Not at all → no where to be found. 原文に「年齢を考慮すると」とありますが、文脈から考えると「没年を考慮すると」の誤りでないかと思われます。ただしここでは原文通りに訳出いたしました。
sen.e: It is certain that he was 20 years old or more when he died considering his age, but a record of his coming-of-age ceremony is nowhere to be found and his adult name is unknown.
